inputs.name: Collector Name
inputs.help_text: Specify a unique name for the TCP Collector.

inputs.name: Server Address
inputs.help_text: Enter the IP address or hostname of the server to collect data from.

inputs.name: Port
inputs.help_text: Specify the port number for the TCP connection.

inputs.name: Enable Authentication
inputs.help_text: Enable or disable authentication for the TCP Collector.

inputs.name: Authentication Key
inputs.help_text: Provide the authentication key if authentication is enabled.

actions.description: Allows the user to add a new TCP Collector to the Profiler.
actions.trigger: Clicking the 'Add' button in the Profiler UI.

actions.description: Allows the user to modify an existing TCP Collector configuration.
actions.trigger: Clicking the 'Edit' button next to a collector in the Profiler UI.

actions.description: Allows the user to remove an existing TCP Collector from the Profiler.
actions.trigger: Clicking the 'Delete' button next to a collector in the Profiler UI.

constraints.constraint: Server Address must be a valid IP address or hostname.
Port must be within the range 1-65535.
Authentication Key is required if authentication is enabled.

errors.message: Collector Name is invalid or already in use.
Server Address is not a valid IP or hostname.
Port number is out of range.
Authentication Key is required when authentication is enabled.

steps: Navigate to Profiler > Collectors > TCP Collector.
Fill in the required fields: Collector Name, Server Address, Port.
Optionally enable authentication and provide an Authentication Key.
workflows.visual_representation: Not available in the provided documentation.

steps: Navigate to Profiler > Collectors > TCP Collector.
Click the 'Edit' button next to the desired collector.
workflows.visual_representation: Not available in the provided documentation.

steps: Navigate to Profiler > Collectors > TCP Collector.
Click the 'Delete' button next to the desired collector.
Confirm the deletion in the prompt.
workflows.visual_representation: Not available in the provided documentation.
